reviews.text: Amazing temple… it was very clean… Nice way to spend some peaceful time with God here and there they will provide prasdam also daily which is unlimited…

Here's a brief history and overview of the Sri Layan Sithi Vinayagar Temple:

*History*

1. *Established in 1925*: The temple was founded by Indian immigrants from the Sri Lankan Tamil community.
2. *Original location*: The temple was initially located at Kreta Ayer Road, but it was relocated to its current site at Keong Saik Road in 1987.

*Temple Features*

1. *Main deity*: Lord Ganesha (Vinayagar), the remover of obstacles.
2. *Architecture*: The temple features a mix of South Indian and Sri Lankan architectural styles.
3. *Shrine rooms*: Separate sanctums for Lord Ganesha, Lord Shiva, and Goddess Durga.

*Festivals and Events*

1. *Vinayagar Chathurthi*: Annual celebration in honor of Lord Ganesha's birthday.
2. *Navaratri*: Celebrated with cultural programs and prayers.
3. *Thaipusam*: Procession in honor of Lord Murugan.

*Community Services*

1. *Cultural classes*: Music, dance, and language classes for children.
2. *Youth programs*: Activities for young devotees.
3. *Charity events*: Support for local and international charitable causes.

*Other Information*

1. *Management*: The temple is managed by the Hindu Endowments Board (HEB).
2. *Visitation*: The temple is open to visitors of all faiths and backgrounds.
This temple gives you a peaceful mind and charming mindset. You can experience the divine and devotion around you. Though it's located in a busy place, it gives you a calm and cool mental update.

Sri Layan Sithi Vinayagar Temple
hosts famous lord Ganesha. Temple is usually crowded with Indian devotees and you can see some Chinese like myself :) it is so peaceful and loving here.  I walked around in the courtyard, offering prayers in 100 circles. After 1 and half year, my business went well. I think it is time to return and show my appreciation for the blessings received.
Wonderful Ol' Hindu temple. Peaceful place to pray.
